title: Police raid on Russian human rights group draws condemnation
description: International human rights experts denounce 'witch hunt' against Nobel Prize-winning group Memorial on Tuesday.

title: Taiwan president announces trip to the Americas, stirring concern
description: Tsai Ing-wen plans to visit allies in Central America at the end of the month, making two unofficial stops in the US.

title: Can the IMF bailout help Sri Lanka exit its economic crisis?
description: The bankrupt nation faces a tough road ahead.

title: US says it is ‘extremely troubled’ by new Israeli settlements law
description: Washington also denounces comments by Israeli minister claiming Palestinian people are 'an invention' of past century.

title: Japan’s PM makes surprise visit to Ukraine in show of support
description: Fumio Kishida visit to Ukraine comes as rival China is visiting Moscow for talks with Russia's president.

title: Russia-China ties enter ‘new era’ as Xi meets Putin in Moscow
description: Xi signs an agreement with Russian president Vladimir Putin cementing their 'no limits' partnership.

title: US jury orders former Haiti mayor to pay $15.5m for rights abuses
description: A US lawsuit accuses the erstwhile mayor of a rural Haitian town of murder, attempted killings and torture.

title: Ramadan to begin on Thursday in Saudi Arabia, Qatar
description: Authorities in several Muslim-majority countries, including Saudi Arabia, declare Thursday as the first day of Ramadan.

title: US targets Iranian drone industry in latest round of sanctions
description: Sanctions target firms and individuals accused of buying drone parts on behalf of the Iranian government.

title: Iran’s Khamenei says US wants to keep Ukraine war going
description: The supreme leader accuses Washington of starting the war, saying it benefits US weapons manufacturers.

title: India arrests Kashmir journalist Irfan Mehraj on ‘terror’ charges
description: Irfan Mehraj, who worked with a prominent human rights organisation, was accused of funding 'terror' activities.

title: Powerful earthquake felt in Afghanistan, Pakistan, India
description: No immediate reports of casualties from tremor felt in Kabul, Islamabad and New Delhi, according to witnesses.

title: Tens of thousands of US education workers launch strike
description: Workers in Los Angeles-area school district, second-largest in US, say wages are not enough to meet high living costs.

title: UN: 10 million lack safe water six months after Pakistan floods
description: Families in flood-hit areas have 'no alternative but to drink and use potentially disease-ridden water', UNICEF says.

title: War-weary Yemenis greet Saudi-Iran deal with caution
description: Riyadh and Tehran may have moved to bury some of their differences, but it is unclear whether same will happen in Yemen.

title: Greek parties bleed votes between a train disaster and election
description: Dozens were killed when a passenger train collided with a freight train in Greece’s worst-ever train accident.

title: US bank failures ‘very different’ from 2008 crisis, Yellen says
description: US treasury secretary hails government intervention to guarantee depositors' money and says banking system is 'sound'.

title: Student killed, 200 people arrested in Kenya protests – police
description: The protests are the first major outbreak of political violence in Kenya since Ruto became president in August 2022.

title: My plagiarised work was used to justify the war on Iraq
description: The chaos I feared a US-led invasion would unleash has destroyed the country I hail from.

title: What is Nowruz and how is the Persian New Year celebrated?
description: Some 300 million people celebrate Nowruz, which has been observed for more than 3,000 years in different regions.

title: A sad, subdued Nowruz for Syria’s Kurds
description: Mourning the people killed in February's massive earthquakes, the community gets together for a scaled-back celebration.

title: World premiere play spotlights US Assyrian diaspora community
description: Martin Yousif Zebari unveils his first play, a look at family dynamics in the aftermath of the 2003 US invasion of Iraq.

title: New generation of Palestinians fighting Israeli raids | Close Up
description: We gain rare access inside the Jenin Battalion as they fight back against Israeli raids in the occupied West Bank.

title: Italian anarchist in solitary confinement warns of his death
description: Alfredo Cospito's hunger strike began last October in protest against a harsh and controversial regime known as 41-bis.

title: Photos: Memorable quotes from the war in Iraq
description: Notable quotes from before, during and after the US-led invasion of Iraq in March 2003 that toppled Saddam Hussein.

title: Activists do Bamako-Ouagadougou walk to urge Mali-Burkina union
description: The prime ministers of Mali and Burkina Faso say they will examine the idea of creating a federation.

title: Nigeria’s Obi petitions court over disputed presidential election
description: Labour Party candidate heads to Supreme Court to challenge ruling party candidate's victory in February poll.

title: Greta Thunberg, climate activists greenlighted to sue Sweden
description: Sweden needs to cut emissions by at least 6.5 to 9.4 million tonnes of CO2 per year starting from 2019, lawsuit says.

title: Saudi Arabia releases US national Almadi from prison: Family
description: Almadi was jailed for 19 years for posts on Twitter criticising the government after landing in Riyadh in 2021.

title: Sri Lanka to get first tranche of $2.9bn bailout in two days: IMF
description: Global lender says island nation battling its worst economic crisis in seven decades will get $330m in next two days.

title: When cricket ‘legends’ brought cheer to a Qatar neighbourhood
description: Pakistani-dominated Asia Lions beat World Giants in the Legends League Cricket tournament hosted by the Gulf state.

title: Arab states condemn Israeli minister’s ‘no Palestinians’ remark
description: Israel's far-right National Security Minister Bezalel Smotrich says there 'isn't a Palestinian people'.

title: Ethiopia says US war crime allegations ‘inflammatory’
description: Antony Blinken, who was in Ethiopia last week, had called for accountability for the horrors of the two-year war.

title: World Poetry Day: Can you tell which poem was written by ChatGPT?
description: We know poetry is subjective, but why don’t you take the quiz below to rate ChatGPT’s poetic prowess?

title: Sunken Philippine oil tanker found after 3 weeks as spill spreads
description: Diesel and thick oil from the downed vessel have contaminated pristine waters with many people falling ill.

title: Winnie the Pooh film dumped in Hong Kong amid censorship claims
description: Cancellation of screenings of British horror film prompts speculation decision relates to sensitives around Xi Jinping.

title: Is Iraq’s sectarian quota system holding the country back?
description: A legacy of the US occupation, the muhasasa system sees political positions divided among different religious sects.

title: Knesset votes to allow Israelis to resettle evacuated outposts
description: The amendment could see Israelis resettle four outposts in the northern occupied West Bank evacuated in 2005.

title: ‘Totally overblown’: Russia calls UN meet on Ukraine’s taken kids
description: Moscow says Russia planned Security Council meeting on the issue long before arrest warrant issued for Vladimir Putin.

title: Russia’s Supreme (Court) loss
description: A recent decision by the UK's top court ruined Putin's efforts to break the Western-led economic order from within.

title: Feminists need to oppose hijab bans as much as hijab mandates
description: From India to France, bigots are scared of the hijab. Why are Western feminists so deafeningly silent about this?

title: Photos: Brazil’s female sumo wrestlers breaking barriers
description: Brazilian women who practise sumo want to spread this form of 'dynamic, strategic, fast, and exciting wrestling'.

title: Wagner warns Russia military chief of imminent Ukraine attack
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin says 'large-scale' offensive aims to cut off his fighters from regular Russian forces.

title: Report finds London’s Met Police ‘racist, misogynist, homophobic’
description: Independent review was commissioned after a young woman was raped and killed by a serving officer.

title: Finch, de Kock unveiled on Major League Cricket draft day
description: Finch, de Kock, Chand named by franchise teams for USA T20 cricket tournament scheduled to take place in July.

title: Credit Suisse and SVB: Is global banking in crisis?
description: Economists caution against comparisons to 2007-08 bank failures despite persistent market turmoil.

title: As Sudan’s rival forces vie for power, who pays the price?
description: Analysts warn that the army and RSF's respective quest to consolidate power could spark a wider conflict.

title: Rafael Nadal drops out of top 10 for first time since 2005
description: Nadal, in the top 10 since April 2005, fell to 13th after injury forced him to miss Indian Wells.

title: Venezuela’s powerful oil tsar resigns amid corruption inquiry
description: Oil minister Tareck El Aissami announces his resignation on Twitter, saying he would cooperate with gov't investigation.

title: Japan’s Fumio Kishida heads to Kyiv to meet Volodymyr Zelenskyy
description: Japanese prime minister to show 'solidarity' with Ukraine in visit that coincides with Chinese leader's Moscow trip.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 391
description: As the Russia-Ukraine war enters its 391st day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: How will a major oil project change East Africa?
description: Uganda and Tanzania hail economic benefits of initiative but activists say it undercuts global climate goals.

title: China welcomes former Taiwan president’s plan to visit
description: Ma Ying-jeou will become the first former or current leader of Taiwan to visit China since 1949.

title: ‘No limits partnership’: Xi and Putin’s key economic priorities
description: Chinese and Russian leaders expected to double down on economic cooperation during three days of meetings in Moscow.

title: Russia says jet scrambled as US B-52 bombers fly over Baltic Sea
description: A Russian Sukhoi Su-35 combat plane was sent to intercept two US B-52H strategic bombers flying over the Baltic Sea.

title: Pushback in Australia against increasingly draconian protest laws
description: Australia is among democracies curbing long-cherished civil and political liberties blaming more radical protesters.

title: Ukraine says Russia Kalibr missile cargo hit in transit to Crimea
description: Ukraine says shipment of Russian Kalibr cruise missiles was destroyed in transit to the Black Sea Fleet in Crimea.

title: Myanmar’s democratic struggle at stake in Thailand’s election
description: Myanmar people in Thailand hope a new government in Bangkok will take a tougher line on the coup leaders in Yangon.

title: Ecuador opens investigation into explosives sent to news media
description: Local journalists report receiving envelopes filled with small explosives, disguised as commonplace electronic devices.
